section.title: File I/O Classes
Customizing IO
section.para: CDK's IO can be customized making it possible to to only partially read a file, or save information in a specific format. All possible customizations have defaults, so that use of the IO classes do not require one to do any customization; it's optional.

Besides the &io.listener.SwingGUIListener; there is also a &io.listener.PropertiesListener; allowing to store customized values for the IO class in a Java Properties class. And there is a &io.listener.TextGUIListener; for use in command line utilities, e.g. cdk-fileconvert.

section.title: Writing new IO classes
section.para: CDK IO classes must implement the &io.ChemObjectIO; interface which is automatically done when the &io.ChemObjectReader; or the &io.ChemObjectWriter; is implemented. The latter two are the interfaces that the CDK readers and writers must implement. The ChemObjectIO interface ensures that common functionality is implemented, while the other two define reader and writer specific methods.
Moreover, a proper CDK reader or writer must have a constructor which takes zero parameters. This is needed to allow other classes to query the class for its IO customization options.

section.title: The DefaultChemObjectReader and -Writer
section.para: The &io.DefaultChemObjectReader; and &io.DefaultChemObjectWriter; classes are abstract classes that define the implementation for a few methods defined by the CDK IO interfaces, which do not necessarily require implementation. Therefore, many CDK IO classes simply extend this class.

section.title: The DummyReader
section.para: The &io.DummyReader; is an abstract class that implements the &io.ChemObjectReader; interface but defines the class as *not* implemented. This is used in a number of dummy readers which can be returned by the ReaderFactory, but can not actually read the file format, but is only used by the Factory to indicate the file format. See &applications.FileFormatGuesser;.
